sen.j: 元始祭（げんしさい）は、戦前の祝祭日の中の大祭日の一つ。
sen.e: Genshisai (shinto festival of origins) is one of taisai jitsu (the day when taisai (grand festival) is performed) among prewar public holidays.

Genshi-sai Festival (the Shinto festival of origins) is one of taisaijitsu (the days when grand festivals are held) in the prewar public holiday system.

sen.j: 現在では新暦1月3日、天皇が宮中三殿（賢所・皇霊殿・神殿）においてみずから主宰する「親祭」であり、皇位の元始を祝ぐ儀式である。
sen.e: Nowadays it is the ritual; `shinsai' which is presided by the emperor himself in the Three Shrines (kensho, Korei-den, shinden) of the Imperial Court to celebrate the beginning of the throne of the emperor in a new year.

Nowadays it is the ritual; `shinsai' which is presided over by the emperor himself in the Three Shrines (kensho, Korei-den, shinden) of the Imperial Court to celebrate the beginning of the enthronement of the emperor in a new year.

Nowadays it is a 'shinsai' (a festival presided over by the emperor himself) held at the Three Shrines in the Imperial Court (Kensho, which is also called Kashikodokoro [the Imperial Sanctuary], Korei-den [the Imperial Ancestors' Shrine], and Shinden [Shrine]) on January 3 in the Gregorian calendar to celebrate the origin of the Imperial throne.

sen.j: 元始祭は、明治3年（1870年）1月3日 (旧暦)、神祇官八神殿に八神・天神地祇・歴代の皇霊を鎮祭したのに始まる。
sen.e: Genshisai originated from chinsai (religious ceremony to appease the gods) which was performed at Hasshinden (eight shrines) of the governor of Jingikan (department of worship) on January 3 (in old calendar), 1870 for appeasing Hasshin (the god), Tenjin chigi (the gods of heaven and earth), and imperial ancestors.

sen.j: 明治6年（1873年）1月3日から現在の三殿親祭の形式となった。
sen.e: The form of Genshisai changed to the current form of sanden (three shrines) shinsai on January 3, 1873.

sen.j: 明治41年（1908年）制定の「皇室祭祀令」（皇室令）において大祭に加えられ、昭和2年（1927年）に祝祭日となった。
sen.e: Genshisai was added to taisai (grand festival) in accordance with Koshitu Saishi Rei; `Imperial household religious rites ordinance' (Koshitsu-rei; the Imperial Families' Act) established in 1908, and it became the public holiday in 1927.

sen.j: 戦後は国民の祝日からは外されたが、宮中では現在でも従来通りの元始祭が行われている。
sen.e: After the war, it was excluded from public holidays; it is still performed in the palace as it was performed in the past.
